featured.text: What can you do if you ‘lose’ the data from your disks?

There have been disks containing medical research, television scripts, manuscripts of whole books, a lawyer’s papers for a court case, and even Margaret Thatcher’s travel plan for a visit to eastern Europe.
Disks are usually sent to the Disk Doctor by post, but sometimes people are in such a hurry that they cannot wait for the mail to come.
When the material has been recovered, the disk is returned to the sender with a diagnosis and a prescription for avoiding the problem in the future.

other.text: It would be difficult to put a value on the things rescued by the Disk Doctor.
Jack and a few of his friends set up a company called “Jack’s Disk Doctor Service” in 1984.
The fees are always the same, no matter how precious the data on the disk is.
Which of the following statements is NOT true? (A) Jack’s Disk Doctor Service has only one standard fee.

definition.zh_def: 圓形的平面物體，通常用於儲存數據或作為運動的部件。
definition.en_def: A flat, circular object, often used for storing data or as a component in machinery.
definition.example: I saved the document on a USB disk.
